title: Mainland China
summary: Mainland China, also known as the Chinese Mainland[1] or China Mainland,[2] is a geopolitical area under the direct jurisdiction of the People's Republic of China (PRC) since 1 October 1949. It includes Hainan, which is an island province in the South China Sea, but it excludes the special administrative regions (Hong Kong and Macau), even though both are mostly on the geographic continental landmass (the "Mainland"), and the claimed region of Taiwan.
